comments.body: The benchmarking documentation was never linked into a TOC
Here, maybe mention to ensure the title and message are clear and self-explanatory (if a user has made multiple commits, the title is the name of the branch and I think there is no text).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +61,65 @@     configure-a-github-account>`.

   * Go to GitHub. The new branch will show up with a green Pull Request
     button. Make sure the title and message are clear, concise, and self-
     explanatory. Then click the button to submit it.

@@ -1,1 +109,113 @@   If your change introduces a deprecation, make sure to discuss this first on
   GitHub or the mailing list first. If agreement on the deprecation is
   reached, follow `NEP 23 `deprecation policy <http://www.numpy.org/neps/
   nep-0023-backwards-compatibility.html>`_  to add the deprecation.

@@ -1,1 +178,182 @@This will create a report in `build/coverage`, which can be viewed with

```
firefox build/coverage/index.html
```

comments.body:
Probably this is not the right WIP to contain this remark, 
I think  "Code maintenance and development" could be categorized into:
1. new to open source community
this could contains high level explanation to the project structure, some less sophisticated functions and the logic behind them to give a walkthrough example of converting a requirement into code that satisfies the contribution guide rules.
I think  previous contributors form GSoC could give better input here.   
2. participated into previous open source project
Thanks @OmarMerghany. Yes, I agree with your comment. Further down on this page we have the part on how to make code contributions, and that section can be further improved (in another PR probably).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@we list them in alphabetical order):

- Code maintenance and development
- Community coordination
- DevOps

comments.body: Hmm yes, this is a frequent stumbling block. We really should switch to `sphinx.ext.mathjax` to get rid of this dependency.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +246,250 @@A working LaTeX document production system 
(e.g. `texlive <https://www.tug.org/texlive/>`__) is required for the
proper rendering of the LaTeX math in the documentation.

Fixing Warnings
